public class ControlCell extends Cell

    Description
    ControlCell(byte command, byte[] circuitId)
    Shell of a control cell (the payload bytes are empty until altered using class methods)

    For a control cell, the command byte has to be an integer 1-3 1 = create -> set up a new circuit 2 = created -> circuit creation is finished 3 = destroy -> destroy the circuit

  • Method Details

    • setPayload

      public void setPayload(byte[] payload) throws IllegalArgumentException
      The payload should reside in the bytes following the 3 first bytes (offset = byte #4)
      Overrides:
      setPayload in class Cell
      Parameters:
      payload - is the body of the cell (data). Ex: the IP address of the node that received the cell
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • setCommand

      public void setCommand(byte command)
      For a control cell, the command byte has to be an integer 1-3 1 = create -> set up a new circuit 2 = created -> circuit creation is finished 3 = destroy -> destroy the circuit
      Overrides:
      setCommand in class Cell
